meanings.def: of the most excellent type or quality
examples: That's the best movie I've ever seen!
He wrote his best songs before he was 25.
She was one of the best tennis players of her generation.
Is that your best suit?
They've been best friends (= closest friends) since they were children.
the company’s best-ever results
We want the kids to have the best possible education.
This is by far the best restaurant in the town.
We aim to give our guests the very best attention.
Who in the class is best at history?

meanings.def: giving most pleasure; happiest
examples: Those were the best years of my life.

meanings.def: most suitable or appropriate
examples: What's the best way to cook steak?
He's the best man for the job.
The best thing to do would be to apologize.
It's best if you go now.
I'm not in the best position to advise you.
Owen judged it best to make no reply.

meanings.def: most; to the greatest extent
examples: Which one do you like best?
Well-drained soil suits the plant best.
her best-known poem

meanings.def: in the most excellent way; to the highest standard
examples: He works best in the mornings.
Britain’s best-dressed woman
The beaches are beautiful, but, best of all, there are very few tourists.

meanings.def: in the most suitable or appropriate way
examples: Painting is best done in daylight.
Do as you think best (= what you think is the most suitable thing to do).

meanings.def: not perfectly but as well as you are able
examples: We'll manage as best we can.

meanings.def: to be famous or known for a particular thing that you have done in the past
examples: He is best remembered as the man who brought jazz to England.
She is best remembered for her first book, ‘In the Ditch’.

idioms.def: not perfectly but as well as you are able
examples: We'll manage as best we can.

idioms.idiom: be (best) remembered for something | be (best) remembered as something
idioms.def: to be famous or known for a particular thing that you have done in the past
examples: He is best remembered as the man who brought jazz to England.
She is best remembered for her first book, ‘In the Ditch’.

meanings.def: the most excellent thing or person
examples: We all want the best for our children.
They only buy the best.
They're all good players, but she's the best of all.
We're the best of friends (= very close friends).

meanings.def: the highest standard that somebody/something can reach
examples: She always brings out the best in people.
The town looks its best (= is most attractive) in the spring.
Don't worry about the exam—just do your best.
The roses are past their best now.
I don't really feel at my best today.

meanings.def: something that is as close as possible to what you need or want
examples: Fifty pounds is the best I can offer you.
The best we can hope for in the game is a draw.

meanings.def: the highest standard that a particular person has reached, especially in a sport
examples: a lifetime best of 12.0 seconds

meanings.def: used when you are saying goodbye to somebody or ending a letter, to give somebody your good wishes
used for saying what is the best opinion you can have of somebody/something, or the best thing that can happen, when the situation is bad
examples: Their response to the proposal was, at best, cool.
We can't arrive before Friday at best.

meanings.def: used to say that although something appears bad or unpleasant now, it will be good in the end
examples: I don't want you to leave, but perhaps it's for the best.

meanings.def: a person or thing that is a little better than the rest of a group, although none are very good
the best out of a group of people or things
used to wish somebody success with something
examples: The best of luck with your exams.
Good luck! I hope it goes well.
(ironic) ‘I'm going to try giving up social media for a year.’ ‘Good luck with that (= I don't think you will succeed).’

meanings.def: up to three, five, etc. games played to decide who wins, the winner being the person who wins most of them
the very best
examples: We make sure our clients get the best that money can buy.

meanings.def: to do or say something in order to achieve a good result or to help somebody
examples: I just don't know what to do for the best.
I'm sorry if my advice offended you—I meant it for the best.

meanings.def: to gain more advantage from something than somebody else
examples: I thought you had the best of that discussion.

meanings.def: to hope that something will happen successfully, especially where it seems likely that it will not
examples: I’m just going to answer all the questions I can and hope for the best.

meanings.def: to accept a bad or difficult situation and do as well as you can
your best clothes
examples: I put on my Sunday best for the occasion.

meanings.def: as far as you know
examples: He never made a will, to the best of my knowledge.

meanings.def: as well as anyone
examples: He'll be out there, dancing with the best of them.

idioms.def: used when you are saying goodbye to somebody or ending a letter, to give somebody your good wishes
used for saying what is the best opinion you can have of somebody/something, or the best thing that can happen, when the situation is bad
examples: Their response to the proposal was, at best, cool.
We can't arrive before Friday at best.

idioms.def: used to say that although something appears bad or unpleasant now, it will be good in the end
examples: I don't want you to leave, but perhaps it's for the best.

idioms.idiom: the best of a bad bunch/lot
idioms.def: a person or thing that is a little better than the rest of a group, although none are very good
the best out of a group of people or things

idioms.idiom: the best of luck (with something) | good luck (with something)
idioms.def: used to wish somebody success with something
examples: The best of luck with your exams.
Good luck! I hope it goes well.
(ironic) ‘I'm going to try giving up social media for a year.’ ‘Good luck with that (= I don't think you will succeed).’

idioms.idiom: the best of three, five, etc.
idioms.def: up to three, five, etc. games played to decide who wins, the winner being the person who wins most of them

idioms.idiom: the best that money can buy
examples: We make sure our clients get the best that money can buy.

idioms.idiom: do, mean, etc. something for the best
idioms.def: to do or say something in order to achieve a good result or to help somebody
examples: I just don't know what to do for the best.
I'm sorry if my advice offended you—I meant it for the best.

idioms.def: to gain more advantage from something than somebody else
examples: I thought you had the best of that discussion.

idioms.def: to hope that something will happen successfully, especially where it seems likely that it will not
examples: I’m just going to answer all the questions I can and hope for the best.

idioms.idiom: make the best of something/it | make the best of things | make the best of a bad job
idioms.def: to accept a bad or difficult situation and do as well as you can

examples: I put on my Sunday best for the occasion.

idioms.idiom: to the best of your knowledge/belief
examples: He never made a will, to the best of my knowledge.
He'll be out there, dancing with the best of them.

meanings.def: to defeat or be more successful than somebody
examples: be bested (by somebody) He was determined not to be bested by his old rival.
A great colonial power was nearly bested by a few farmers.

meanings.def: a British magazine aimed at women that contains articles on health, fashion, sex, food, famous people and entertainment. It first appeared in 1987 and is published every week.
